text.tspan: Network redundancy: The controller creates two sockets to the IO device.
TCP socket from controller 1 to IO
all inputs from the IO device and writes
all ouputs. This connection is active, thus
the IO device uses output states from
The active connection is selected by device. It is the connection with highest priority
which has open TCP socket and is receiving ALIVE signal from a controller. ALIVE signal
is a byte in output memory block, which is incremented constantly, for example once
per second. Controller PRIORITY is also byte in in output memory block.
from which network has lower maximum
latency. In this case network priority
could be used to select between multiple
connect to the same IO device, either
